003 * image processing published by Springer-Verlag in various languages and editions.
004 * Permission to use and distribute this software is granted under the BSD 2-Clause

008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.geometry.basic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.awt.Point;
015import java.awt.Shape;
016import java.awt.geom.Arc2D;
017import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
018import java.util.Locale;
019
020import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.twod.Vector2D;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
022import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
023
024/** 
025 * Interface specifying the behavior of simple 2D points. 
026 * It is used to adapt to different (legacy) point implementations 
027 * with a common API. 
028 * To some extent this is similar to the functionality provided by
029 * {@link Point2D} and {@link Point}
030 * but was re-implemented to avoid dependency on AWT and for
031 * more flexibility in naming and class structure.
032 * Since defined as an interface, {@link Pnt2d} can be easily implemented 
033 * by other point-like structures, e.g. corners 
034 * (see {@link imagingbook.common.corners.Corner}).
035 * <br>
036 * Two concrete (nested) classes are defined for points with {@code double}
037 * and {@code int} coordinates, respectively.
038 * See {@link Pnt2d.PntDouble} and {@link Pnt2d.PntInt} for how
039 * to instantiate such point objects.
040 * 
041 */
042public interface Pnt2d extends ShapeProvider {
043        
044        /**
045         * The default tolerance for matching coordinates (1E-6).
046         */
047        public final static double TOLERANCE = 1E-6;
048        
049        /**
050         * Returns the x-coordinate of this point.
051         * @return the x-coordinate value
052         */
053        double getX();
054        
055        /**
056         * Returns the y-coordinate of this point.
057         * @return the y-coordinate value
058         */
059        double getY();
060        
061        /**
062         * Returns the x-coordinate of this point as a 
063         * (truncated) integer value.
064         * @return the integer x-coordinate of this point.
065         */
066        public default int getXint() {
067                return (int) this.getX();
068        }
069        
070        /**
071         * Returns the y-coordinate of this point as a 
072         * (truncated) integer value.
073         * @return the integer y-coordinate of this point.
074         */
075        public default int getYint() {
076                return (int) this.getY();
077        }
078        
079        // ----------------------------------------------------------
080        
081        /**
082         * Creates and returns a new point of type {@link Pnt2d.PntInt}
083         * with the specified coordinates.
084         * See also {@link PntInt#from(int, int)}.
085         * @param x coordinate
086         * @param y coordinate
087         * @return the new point
088         */
089        public static Pnt2d from(int x, int y) {
090                return PntInt.from(x, y);
091        }
092        
093        /**
094         * Creates and returns a new point of type {@link Pnt2d.PntInt}
095         * with the specified coordinates.
096         * See also {@link PntInt#from(int[])}.
097         * 
098         * @param xy coordinates
099         * @return the new point
100         */
101        public static Pnt2d from(int[] xy) {
102                return PntInt.from(xy);
103        }
104        
105        /**
106         * Creates and returns a new point of type {@link Pnt2d.PntDouble}
107         * with the specified coordinates.
108         * See also {@link PntDouble#from(double, double)}.
109         * 
110         * @param x coordinate
111         * @param y coordinate
112         * @return the new point
113         */
114        public static Pnt2d from(double x, double y) {
115                return PntDouble.from(x, y);
116        }
117        
118        /**
119         * Creates and returns a new point of type {@link Pnt2d.PntDouble}
120         * with the specified coordinates.
121         * See also {@link PntDouble#from(double[])}.
122         * 
123         * @param xy coordinates
124         * @return the new point
125         */
126        public static Pnt2d from(double[] xy) {
127                return PntDouble.from(xy[0], xy[1]);
128        }
129        
130        public static Pnt2d from(Point2D p) {
131                if (p instanceof Point) {
132                        Point pi = (Point) p;
133                        return PntInt.from(pi.x, pi.y);
134                }
135                else {
136                        return PntDouble.from(p.getX(), p.getY());
137                }
138        }
139        
140        // ----------------------------------------------------------
141        
142        /**
143         * Returns this point's coordinates as a new 2-element {@code double} array.
144         * @return the array
145         */
146        public default double[] toDoubleArray() {
147                return new double[] {this.getX(), this.getY()};
148        }
149        
150        /**
151         * Returns this point's coordinates as a new AWT {@link Point2D.Double} point.
152         * @return the new point
153         */
154        public default Point2D.Double toAwtPoint2D() {
155                return new Point2D.Double(this.getX(), this.getY());
156        }
157        
158        /**
159         * Returns this point's coordinates as a new {@link Vector2D} instance
160         * (for interfacing with Apache Commons Math).
161         * @return a new vector
162         */
163        public default Vector2D toVector2D() {
164                return new Vector2D(getX(), getY());
165        }
166        
167        /**
168         * Returns this point's coordinates as a new {@link RealVector} instance
169         * (for interfacing with Apache Commons Math).
170         * @return a new vector
171         */
172        public default RealVector toRealVector() {
173                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(this.toDoubleArray());
174        }
175        
176        /**
177         * Returns a copy of this point which is of the same type as the original.
178         * @return a new instance.
179         */
180        public default Pnt2d duplicate() {
181                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
182        }
183        
184        /**
185         * Returns a new point whose coordinates are the sum of this point and 
186         * the given point. The concrete type of the returned object depends on the type
187         * of the original points.
188         * @param p the point to be added
189         * @return a new point
190         */
191        public default Pnt2d plus(Pnt2d p) {
192                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
193        }
194        
195        /**
196         * Returns a new point whose coordinates are the sum of this point and 
197         * the specified {@code double} coordinates.
198         * @param dx the x-coordinate to be added 
199         * @param dy the y-coordinate to be added 
200         * @return a new point
201         */
202        public default Pnt2d plus(double dx, double dy) {
203                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
204        }
205        
206        /**
207         * Returns a new point whose coordinates are the sum of this point and 
208         * the specified {@code int} coordinates.
209         * The concrete type of the returned object depends on the type
210         * of the original point.
211         * @param dx the x-coordinate to be added 
212         * @param dy the y-coordinate to be added 
213         * @return a new point
214         */
215        public default Pnt2d plus(int dx, int dy) {
216                return plus((double)dx, (double)dy);
217        }
218        
219        /**
220         * Returns a new point whose coordinates are the difference of this point and 
221         * the given point. The concrete type of the returned object depends on the type
222         * of the original points.
223         * @param p the point to be subtracted
224         * @return a new point
225         */
226        public default Pnt2d minus(Pnt2d p) {
227                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
228        }
229        
230        // ----------------------------------------------------------
231
232        /**
233         * Tests if this point matches the given point, i.e., if
234         * both coordinate differences are zero (&lt; than 
235         * the specified tolerance).
236         *  
237         * @param p the point to be matched to
238         * @param tolerance the tolerance (see also {@link #TOLERANCE}).
239         * @return true if both points match
240         */
241        public default boolean equals(Pnt2d p, double tolerance) {
242                return isZero(this.getX() - p.getX(), tolerance) 
243                        && isZero(this.getY() - p.getY(), tolerance);
244        }
245        
246        // ----------------------------------------------------------
247        
248        /**
249         * Returns the squared L2 distance between this point and the
250         * given point.
251         * 
252         * @param other the other point
253         * @return the squared distance
254         */
255        public default double distanceSq(Pnt2d other) {
256                return sqr(this.getX() - other.getX()) + sqr(this.getY() - other.getY());
257        }
258        
259        /**
260         * Returns the L2 (Euclidean) distance between this point and the
261         * given point. This method is equivalent to {@link #distL2(Pnt2d)}.
262         * 
263         * @param other the other point
264         * @return the distance
265         */
266        public default double distance(Pnt2d other) {
267                return Math.sqrt(this.distanceSq(other));
268        }
269        
270        /**
271         * Returns the L2 (Euclidean) distance between this point and the
272         * given point. This method is equivalent to {@link #distance(Pnt2d)}.
273         * 
274         * @param other the other point
275         * @return the distance
276         */
277        public default double distL2(Pnt2d other) {
278                return distance(other);
279        }
280        
281        /**
282         * Returns the L1 (Manhattan) distance between this point and the
283         * given point. 
284         * 
285         * @param other the other point
286         * @return the distance
287         */
288        public default double distL1(Pnt2d other) {
289                return Math.abs(this.getX() - other.getX()) + Math.abs(this.getY() - other.getY());
290        }
291        
292        public static final double DefaultDotRadius = 1.0;
293        
294        /**
295         * Returns a round dot ({@link Shape} instance) for drawing this point.
296         * 
297         * @param scale the dot radius
298         * @return the shape
299         */
300        @Override
301        public default Shape getShape(double scale) {
302                double rad = scale * DefaultDotRadius;
303                Shape circ= new Arc2D.Double(
304                        this.getX() - rad, 
305                        this.getY() - rad, 
306                        2 * rad, 2 * rad,
307                        0, 360, Arc2D.CHORD);
308                return circ;
309        }
310        
311        // ----------------------------------------------------------
312        
313        /**
314         * Immutable 2D point implementation with {@code double} coordinates.
315         * This class implements the {@link Pnt2d} interface.
316         * A public constructor ({@link #PntDouble(double, double)})
317         * is provided but the preferred way of instantiation is
318         * by one of the static factory methods, such as
319         * {@link #from(double, double)},
320         * {@link #from(double[])}, etc.
321         * Access to the coordinate values is provided by the methods
322         * {@link #getX()} and {@link #getY()}, but the
323         * actual field variables {@link #x}, {@link #y} are also 
324         * publicly accessible (for better performance and less clutter).
325         */
326        public class PntDouble implements Pnt2d {
327                
328                /**
329                 * Singleton point instance with zero coordinates.
330                 */
331                public static final PntDouble ZERO = PntDouble.from(0.0, 0.0);
332
333                /** The (immutable) x-coordinate of this point */
334                public final double x;
335                /** The (immutable) y-coordinate of this point */
336                public final double y;
337
338                /**
339                 * Constructor.
340                 * @param x x-coordinate
341                 * @param y y-coordinate
342                 */
343                protected PntDouble(double x, double y) {
344                        this.x = x;
345                        this.y = y;
346                }
347                
348                @Override
349                public PntDouble duplicate() {
350                        return new PntDouble(this.x, this.y);
351                }
352                
353                // static factory methods ---------------------------------
354                
355                /**
356                 * Returns a new {@link PntDouble} instance.
357                 * @param xy x/y-coordinate array
358                 * @return the new point
359                 */
360                public static PntDouble from(double[] xy) {
361                        return new PntDouble(xy[0], xy[1]);
362                }
363                
364                /**
365                 * Returns a new {@link PntDouble} instance.
366                 * @param x x-coordinate value
367                 * @param y y-coordinate value
368                 * @return the new point
369                 */
370                public static PntDouble from(double x, double y) {
371                        return new PntDouble(x, y);
372                }
373                
374                /**
375                 * Returns a new {@link PntDouble} instance with the same coordinates as the given point.
376                 * Equivalent to {@link #duplicate()}.
377                 * @param p the original point
378                 * @return the new point
379                 */
380                public static PntDouble from(Pnt2d p) {
381                        return new PntDouble(p.getX(), p.getY());
382                }
383                
384                /**
385                 * Returns a new {@link PntDouble} instance
386                 * with the same coordinates as the given AWT {@link Point2D}.
387                 * @param p the original AWT point
388                 * @return the new point
389                 */
390                public static PntDouble from(Point2D p) {
391                        return new PntDouble(p.getX(), p.getY());
392                }
393                
394                /**
395                 * Returns a new {@link PntDouble} instance
396                 * with the same coordinates as the given Apache Commons Math
397                 * {@link Vector2D}.
398                 * @param vec the original coordinate vector
399                 * @return the new point
400                 */
401                public static PntDouble from(Vector2D vec) {
402                        return new PntDouble(vec.getX(), vec.getY());
403                }       
404                
405                // getter methods
406                
407                @Override
408                public double getX() {
409                        return this.x;
410                }
411
412                @Override
413                public double getY() {
414                        return this.y;
415                }
416                
417                @Override
418                public int getXint() {
419                        return (int) this.x;
420                }
421
422                @Override
423                public int getYint() {
424                        return (int) this.y;
425                }
426                
427                
428                // addition -----------------------------------
429                
430                @Override
431                public PntDouble plus(Pnt2d p) {
432                        return new PntDouble(this.x + p.getX(), this.y + p.getY());
433                }
434                
435                @Override
436                public PntDouble plus(double dx, double dy) {
437                        return new PntDouble(this.x + dx, this.y + dy);
438                }
439                
440                // subtraction -----------------------------------
441                
442                @Override
443                public PntDouble minus(Pnt2d p) {
444                        return new PntDouble(this.x - p.getX(), this.y - p.getY());
445                }
446                
447                // equality -----------------------------------
448                
449                @Override
450                public boolean equals(Object p) {
451                        if (this == p) {
452                                return true;
453                        }
454                        if (p instanceof Pnt2d) {
455                                return this.equals((Pnt2d) p, TOLERANCE);
456                        }
457                        return false;
458                }
459                
460                // misc -----------------------------------
461                
462                @Override
463                public String toString() {
464                        return String.format(Locale.US, "%s[%.3f, %.3f]", 
465                                        getClass().getSimpleName(), x, y);
466                }
467                
468                @Override
469            public int hashCode() {     // taken from awt.Point2D.Double
470                long bits = java.lang.Double.doubleToLongBits(this.x);
471                bits ^= java.lang.Double.doubleToLongBits(this.y) * 31;
472                return (((int) bits) ^ ((int) (bits >> 32)));
473            }
474
475        }
476        
477        // ----------------------------------------------------------
478        
479        /**
480         * Immutable 2D point implementation with {@code int} coordinates.
481         * This class implements the {@link Pnt2d} interface.
482         * A public constructor ({@link #PntInt(int, int)})
483         * is provided but the preferred way of instantiation is
484         * by one of the static factory methods, such as
485         * {@link #from(int, int)},
486         * {@link #from(int[])}, etc.
487         * The {@code int} coordinates can only be retrieved via the
488         * publicly accessible field variables {@link #x}, {@link #y},
489         * while the methods {@link #getX()} and {@link #getY()}
490         * return {@code double} values for compatibility reasons.
491         */
492        public class PntInt implements Pnt2d {
493                
494                /**
495                 * Singleton point instance with zero coordinates.
496                 */
497                public static final PntInt ZERO = PntInt.from(0, 0);
498                
499                /** The (immutable) x-coordinate of this point */
500                public final int x;
501                /** The (immutable) y-coordinate of this point */
502                public final int y;
503
504                
505                /**
506                 * Constructor.
507                 * @param x x-coordinate
508                 * @param y y-coordinate
509                 */
510                protected PntInt(int x, int y) {
511                        this.x = x;
512                        this.y = y;
513                }
514                
515                @Override
516                public PntInt duplicate() {
517                        return new PntInt(this.x, this.y);
518                }
519                
520                // static factory methods --------------------------------------
521                
522                /**
523                 * Returns a new {@link PntInt} instance from
524                 * a given point.
525                 * @param p the original point
526                 * @return the new point
527                 */
528                public static PntInt from(PntInt p) {
529                        return new PntInt(p.x, p.y);
530                }
531                
532                /**
533                 * Returns a new {@link PntInt} instance.
534                 * @param x x-coordinate value
535                 * @param y y-coordinate value
536                 * @return the new point
537                 */
538                public static PntInt from(int x, int y) {
539                        return new PntInt(x, y);
540                }
541                
542                /**
543                 * Returns a new {@link PntInt} instance.
544                 * @param xy x/y-coordinates
545                 * @return the new point
546                 */
547                public static PntInt from(int[] xy) {
548                        return new PntInt(xy[0], xy[1]);
549                }
550                
551                /**
552                 * Returns a new {@link PntInt} from a given {@link Pnt2d} instance.
553                 * This only works if the argument is of type {@link Pnt2d.PntInt},
554                 * otherwise an exception is thrown.
555                 * 
556                 * @param p a point of type {@link Pnt2d.PntInt}
557                 * @return the new point
558                 */
559                public static PntInt from(Pnt2d p) {
560                        if (p instanceof PntInt) {
561                                return ((PntInt) p).duplicate();
562                        }
563                        else {
564                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot convert to " +
565                                                        PntInt.class.getSimpleName());
566                        }
567                }
568                
569                /**
570                 * Returns a new {@link PntDouble} instance
571                 * with the same coordinates as the given AWT {@link Point}.
572                 * @param p the original AWT point
573                 * @return the new point
574                 */
575                public static PntInt from(Point p) {
576                        return new PntInt(p.x, p.y);
577                }
578                
579                // getter methods
580
581                @Override
582                public double getX() {
583                        return this.x;
584                }
585
586                @Override
587                public double getY() {
588                        return this.y;
589                }
590                
591                @Override
592                public int getXint() {
593                        return this.x;
594                }
595
596                @Override
597                public int getYint() {
598                        return this.y;
599                }
600                
601                // addition -----------------------------------
602                
603                @Override
604                public PntInt plus(Pnt2d p) {
605                        if (p instanceof PntInt) {               
606                                return new PntInt(this.x + ((PntInt)p).x, this.y + ((PntInt)p).y);
607                        }
608                        else throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot add " + p.getClass().getSimpleName() + " to " +
609                                        this.getClass().getSimpleName());
610                }
611                
612                @Override
613                public PntInt plus(double dx, double dy) {
614                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot add (double, double) to " +
615                                        this.getClass().getSimpleName());
616                }
617                
618                @Override
619                public PntInt plus(int dx, int dy) {
620                        return new PntInt(this.x + dx, this.y + dy);
621                }
622                
623                // subtraction -----------------------------------
624                
625                @Override
626                public PntInt minus(Pnt2d p) {
627                        if (p instanceof PntInt) {               
628                                return new PntInt(this.x - ((PntInt)p).x, this.y - ((PntInt)p).y);
629                        }
630                        else throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot subtract " + p.getClass().getSimpleName() + " from " +
631                                        this.getClass().getSimpleName());
632                }
633                
634                // distance -----------------------------------
635                
636                /**
637                 * Returns the L1 (Manhattan) distance between this point and the
638                 * given point. 
639                 * 
640                 * @param p the other point
641                 * @return the distance
642                 */
643                public int distL1(PntInt p) {
644                        return Math.abs(this.x - p.x) + Math.abs(this.y - p.y);
645                }
646                
647                /**
648                 * Returns the squared L2 distance between this point and the
649                 * given point.
650                 * 
651                 * @param other the other point
652                 * @return the squared distance
653                 */
654                public int distanceSq(PntInt other) {
655                        return sqr(this.x - other.x) + sqr(this.y - other.y);
656                }
657                
658                // equality -----------------------------------
659                
660                @Override
661                public boolean equals(Object p) {
662                        if (this == p) {
663                                return true;
664                        }
665                        if (p instanceof PntInt) {
666                                PntInt pp = (PntInt) p;
667                                return (this.x == pp.x) && (this.y == pp.y);
668                        }
669                        if (p instanceof Pnt2d) {
670                                return this.equals((Pnt2d) p, TOLERANCE);
671                        }
672                        return false;
673                }
674                
675                // misc -----------------------------------
676                
677                @Override
678                public String toString() {
679                        return String.format(Locale.US, "%s[%d, %d]", 
680                                        getClass().getSimpleName(), x, y);
681                }
682                
683//              @Override
684//              public int hashCode() {
685//                      return (17 + this.x) * 37 + this.y;     
686//              }
687                
688                @Override
689            public int hashCode() {
690                long bits = java.lang.Double.doubleToLongBits(getX());
691                bits ^= java.lang.Double.doubleToLongBits(getY()) * 31;
692                return (((int) bits) ^ ((int) (bits >> 32)));
693            }
694                
695                
696                /**
697                 * Returns this point's coordinates as a new 2-element {@code int} array.
698                 * @return the array
699                 */
700                public int[] toIntArray() {
701                        return new int[] {this.x, this.y};
702                }
703                
704                /**
705                 * Returns this point's coordinates as a new AWT {@link Point} point.
706                 * @return the new point
707                 */
708                public Point toAwtPoint() {
709                        return new Point(this.x, this.y);
710                }
711
712
713                
714        }
715        
716        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
717        
718//      public static void main(String[] args) {
719//              PntInt a = PntInt.from(10,  7);
720//              PntInt b = PntInt.from(3,  5);
721//              System.out.println(" a = " + a.getClass());
722//              System.out.println(" b = " + b.getClass());
723//              System.out.println("dist1 = " + a.distL1(b));
724//              System.out.println("dist2 = " + a.distL1(b));
725//      }
726}
